task: Two nearby lampposts are perpendicular to the ground, which is flat. One of the lampposts is 11 feet tall and has a shadow that is 7 feet long. At the same time, the shadow of the other lamppost is 5 feet long. How tall, in feet, is the other lamppost? (Assume that at a given point in time, the right triangles formed by the lampposts and their respective shadows are similar.)
explanation:
The correct answer is 7.86. Since the triangles are similar, the proportion is:
11/7 = x/5.
Solving for x gives: x = (11 × 5) / 7 = 7.86 feet.
